summary: This is a docket notice from the Second Circuit Court of Appeals regarding the case United States v. Epstein. It records the receipt of a stipulation filed under Federal Rule of Appellate Procedure 42(b) to voluntarily dismiss the appeal with prejudice. The notice includes service information for the attorneys involved.

persons.name: Martin G. Weinberg
persons.context: Listed as an attorney to receive electronic notice of the court filing regarding the stipulation to withdraw the appeal with prejudice.

persons.name: Reid Weingarten
persons.context: Listed as an attorney to receive electronic notice of the court filing regarding the stipulation to withdraw the appeal with prejudice.

persons.name: Donnell G. Bolden
persons.context: Identified as a Deputy Clerk for the Second Circuit Court of Appeals, associated with the docket activity notice.

events.title: Stipulation to Withdraw Appeal with Prejudice Filed
events.description: A stipulation under Federal Rule of Appellate Procedure 42(b) was filed in the Second Circuit Court of Appeals, agreeing to voluntarily dismiss the appeal in case 19-2221 (United States v. Epstein) with prejudice.

keyFacts: The document is a docket notice from the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit for case 19-2221, United States v. Epstein.
It records the filing of a FRAP 42(b) stipulation to voluntarily dismiss an appeal with prejudice, effectively ending that appellate proceeding.
Attorneys Martin G. Weinberg and Reid Weingarten are listed as recipients of the notice, indicating their representation in the matter.
The filing date is August 20, 2019, which is shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody on August 10, 2019.
